utterance.speaker: Spencer
utterance.content: Wow.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Spencer
utterance.content: Come back to bed.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Gimme a minute.

utterance.speaker: Spencer
utterance.content: You get 20 seconds.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Hey, what are you—

utterance.speaker: EMT
utterance.content: Female, late 20s, tonic clonic seizure.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Duration of the seizure?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: A little over three minutes.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Does your friend have a history of epilepsy?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: She never said.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: My name is Dr. Cameron. You're in a hospital. We’re gonna take care of you. What’s her name?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I don't know.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: House.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Eh.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I have a case I think you might be interested in.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not now.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: A 26-year-old woman had a tonic clonic seizure.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What about me speeding away says to you "let's chat"?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: History of fatigue, and two years ago she had a retinal vein occlusion.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She’s diabetic.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: No, she's not. And she has no history of hypertension.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It can wait.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I knew I should've set up a video camera. Stay there.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, my goodness. I played a practical joke on my best friend, and he's badly injured.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I wish I had learned this valuable lesson earlier. I was waiting by my window for an hour. Why are you late?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I had a breakfast meeting at Mickey’s Diner with the Mercy people to tell them… I’m coming back to work here. Sorry if it interfered with your plan to maim me. Donut’s a nice touch.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It’s my way of saying "welcome back."

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: The seizure could be the result of dehydration or something neurological.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Or the ecstasy you found in her system.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: According to Dr. Hadley, the patient took the drugs about five hours before the seizure, so…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What does Thirteen know about it?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Uh, apparently she was with the patient last night.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: At 3:00 AM?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, yeah! Penthouse forum meets medical mystery. Maybe there is a God.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Empty transient sex? I’ve been waiting for you to spiral out of control, ever since you got your Huntington’s diagnosis, but this is more than I dared hope for.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Patient’s seizure resulted from dehydration, which resulted from a cocktail of alcohol and ecstasy. Mystery solved.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Wait. Were you doing drugs?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Not diagnostically relevant.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Depends what we're trying to diagnose. It’s how steep of a spiral you're on.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Our patient hemorrhaged into her eye two years ago.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Also not diagnostically relevant. Retinal vein occlusion was fixed. Her doctor said it was a venous anomaly.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Is he in this room? Because if he's not, I don't care what he thinks. Unless he's a she and she was there last night too, in which case I care very deeply.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: What if the eye problem wasn't with her vein, but with her blood? Would explain why she seized, why she's always tired.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: She parties till 3:00 AM. That’s why she's always tired.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yet you seem fine.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: She’s visited four other doctors in the past year. None of them found anything. She’s a hypochondriac who drank too much.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Blood clots could explain everything.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Makes sense. Bone marrow’s in overdrive. Too many platelets. Sorry.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Thirteen, go stick a needle in your girlfriend's pelvis. And no, that one wasn't a metaphor. Suck out some marrow. That one was.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I like to watch.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I can handle this alone.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You’ve already handled it. That’s why you need a chaperone. Of course, I’m a very permissive, understanding chaperone. So feel free to ignore me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You know, if you're in the mood to start kissing, or groping, or showering.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You’ll have to excuse Dr. House. He mistakes immaturity for edginess.

utterance.speaker: Spencer
utterance.content: You’re Dr. House?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I assume my name came up last night in the form of a moan. You had sex, then a seizure. Could be a particular position or activity that set it off. That sounds like a valid medical theory, doesn't it?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I’m really sorry. Just ignore him.

utterance.speaker: Spencer
utterance.content: Whatever you think we did, we — we did. And then some.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Lights on or off?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Do you have a medical rationalization for that one?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Light sensitivity.

utterance.speaker: Spencer
utterance.content: On.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Figured she had more shame than that. Did she talk dirty, or did you rely on vague hand signals?

utterance.speaker: Spencer
utterance.content: She’s, uh, pretty direct about what she wants.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I’m learning so much.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Okay, score the score. Scale of one to ten.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Don’t answer.

utterance.speaker: Spencer
utterance.content: Seven.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Finally got one right.

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: You want to investigate him because he ate a donut?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He claimed he had a morning meeting at Mickey’s Diner. Wilson loves Mickey’s Diner. He has the French toast tower whenever he sets foot in the door. There’s no way he would've come to work wanting more carbs. He lied to me. I need to know why.

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: What do you think you'll find out?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I’m worried that he might be, a spy.

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: He’s been gone four months. You're worried the friendship has changed.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I’m just not sure if he's working for Hirohito or the New England Patriots.

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: You played a practical joke on him. He didn't laugh.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I need something to lord over him, a lie —

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: He didn't try to retaliate. He moralized.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He always moralized.

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: He always moralized and got even. He hasn't fired back.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Things always change.

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: And that sucks.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah. Find out where he was.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Should’ve known it wasn't a coincidence. Found your letters. You recognized House's name. And you're the first patient I’ve seen who actually enjoyed being accosted by him.

utterance.speaker: Spencer
utterance.content: I would've told you, but —

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: What exactly would you have told me? That you slept with me to get to House? That you've been trying to get him to take your case for over a year?

utterance.speaker: Spencer
utterance.content: I’m sick. No one even wrote back.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You used me.

utterance.speaker: Spencer
utterance.content: You used me.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: My motives were clear.

utterance.speaker: Spencer
utterance.content: You might've figured out my motives faster if you bothered to ask my name. I followed you to that bar because I wanted to talk to you. See if you'd help me get to House. I didn't expect you to be so aggressive.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Was that seizure even real?

utterance.speaker: Spencer
utterance.content: Why would I fake a symptom? It would just make it harder for House to diagnose me.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: There’s nothing to diagnose. Your biopsy results are negative.

utterance.speaker: Spencer
utterance.content: Then it's something else.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Get dressed. I’m discharging you.

utterance.speaker: Spencer
utterance.content: House admitted me. He obviously thinks —

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: House is using you as an excuse to stick his nose in my personal life.

utterance.speaker: Spencer
utterance.content: I’m tired all the time. Some nights I fall asleep at 10:00 and wake up at noon, still tired. Every doctor I see tells me there's nothing wrong.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: And that proves what, exactly? That they're wrong, or that you're wrong?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Oh, come on. You expect me to believe — Sit back. Deep breaths. Try and relax.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Get the paddles. She’s gonna crash. Damn.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: We had to use paddles to stabilize the patient's heart.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Eye issue, brain issue, now a heart issue. Sounds like a real case to me.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Yeah, I get it. I was wrong. Can we move on?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You’re just upset… Because the whole time she was with you, she was thinking of my huge, throbbing… Diagnostic skills. Drugs would explain everything.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: This morning, you rejected drugs.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That’s when I thought that Thirteen was right and was just jerking her around. Cardiac arrest means she could be a serious user.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Great.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: That means that something she did at my place set this off. Either she brought drugs in, or she grabbed something from my medicine cabinet. And that means my place needs to be searched. Now, I’d be happy to do that myself, but unfortunately that would be far less titillating for House, so he's about to come up with some convoluted medical reason why I have to stay here while he goes through my stuff.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Patient’s dad had bypass surgery. Means she's a candidate for atherosclerosis. She needs an ultrasound. That was much less convoluted than what you just said.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I’m not giving you my keys. If you want to do this, I’m going.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Who could pick a lock?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I’ll go. Make sure he doesn't steal any underwear.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You’re a disgrace to your stereotype. Move over.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Think you can pick a lock faster than me?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No need to pick.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Nice. Steal from your employees.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Never. I had my dick make keys when I hired him to dick up the team.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Always imagined she'd have a sex swing in the living room.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Give me my key.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Don’t have your key.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You expect me to believe that you hired Lucas to investigate everyone except for me?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Waste of money.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I already know everything about you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Thirteen had her purse. That’s gotta be the patient's. Check it for drugs. I call shotgun on the bedroom.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You know that I stole a car when I was a teenager. You know that my mom has Alzheimer’s. You know nothing else.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Want me to have you investigated? When did you get so needy?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Not needy. Just don't buy it. You always want more information about people. Look where we are.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Purse is clean.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Last night wasn't the first time that Thirteen brought home some strange.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You found her diary —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No toys. You sleep with the same person over and over, that's when you need accessories. First time is plenty exciting on its own. Unless…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You think an asthma inhaler could be used as a sex toy?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: There are ways of getting to know people without committing felonies.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: People interest me. Conversations don't.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Because conversations go both ways.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Brown recluse. Found it at your apartment. Their venom can cause seizures and heart problems. Unless the ultrasound showed anything —

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: No. What room did you find it in?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Bathroom. Nice bidet, by the way. Very refreshing.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I don't have a bidet.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh. Spider’s not the only interesting thing I found.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Yeah, my inhaler is fascinating. It’s got its own extensive online following.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You have asthma?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: When I was a kid. It started acting up again when I moved into my new place.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: You moved?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Who cares?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He doesn't. He’s just surprised he didn't know. You withhold things other people would never bother to. The move, a little wheeze, whatever you thought was in my pocket instead of your inhaler. Maybe I should make a return trip to your place.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Spider bite doesn't explain anything unless the patient was actually bitten by a spider. I’ll do the exam.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Don’t be ridiculous. That would be inappropriate. It’d be better if a woman gropes her. There’s no sexual tension that way.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I need you to stand up and take off your gown.

utterance.speaker: Spencer
utterance.content: I think I would've felt a spider biting me.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Not necessarily.

utterance.speaker: Spencer
utterance.content: You really need those after everything we did the other night?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: The other night I wasn't your doctor.

utterance.speaker: Spencer
utterance.content: How long are you gonna stay mad at me?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: How long are you going to be here?

utterance.speaker: Spencer
utterance.content: Oh. Okay, then.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Look… I really had no intention of ever seeing you again.

utterance.speaker: Spencer
utterance.content: So… Having me end up here is a little less than ideal. I get it. But… We just met. How’d you know you didn't want to see me again?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: It’s nothing personal. I’m just really not that into repeat performances.

utterance.speaker: Spencer
utterance.content: I figured I wasn't the first girl you cruised.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Why is that?

utterance.speaker: Spencer
utterance.content: You’re awfully good at it.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You’d think with all that experience that I’d be better than a seven.

utterance.speaker: Spencer
utterance.content: We just met. We were both drunk. Not like there wasn't potential. Little more practice for the both of us, I’d say we're looking at a nine. Easy. But that would require a repeat performance. You didn't have to move your hand.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I didn't. My hand's on your hip. You don't feel that?

utterance.speaker: Spencer
utterance.content: No. What does that mean?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: It means it's not a spider bite.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Blood test confirms low potassium levels. Explains the numbness in her hip. It’s not good, but I think we've got time for at least one or two comments about my personal life.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Which you just wasted with that comment about my comments. Low potassium means her heart problem was a symptom of a kidney problem. What caused the kidney problem?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Could be IgA nephropathy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not without blood in the urine.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: PSAGN?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not with normal blood pressure.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Renal tubular acidosis. Her kidney's don't filter acid out of the blood. Excess acid drives down potassium, causes kidney calcifications.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If it's RTA, all she needs is sodium bicarbonate for the acid and surgery to remove the calcifications. CT her kidneys. If you find calcifications, we have our diagnosis.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What’s he doing now?

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: He’s playing that carjacking video game. He’d get a lot farther if he didn't stop at all the red lights.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Maybe he was doing something he thinks I’ll mock him for.

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: Like…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Just about anything.

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: You don't think it's that.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I don't think it's just about anything?

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: You don't think it's about anything trivial. If you weren't worried, you wouldn't be sitting in my car.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Maybe he's seeing a shrink.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Doesn’t matter if it isn't. Wilson doesn't buy his “pizza.” There’s eight units in this building. There’s got to be a pervert like me living in at least one of them.

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: Yes, because you represent one out of every eight people living in this country. Apparently he has developed a taste for pizza.

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: Ah, things change.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: CT shows one more calcification near the superior pyramid on the left kidney.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: See it.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: That, um, thing, you were hoping House didn't find at your place. I, uh, I found it.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You did the CAG test two weeks ago. A number this high means you have less time than you thought. It’s understandable you'd be upset. Doesn’t mean you have to self-destruct.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: It’s not noble for you to protect me from House if you're just gonna judge —

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: There are things you should be doing. Working out, improving balance and coordination.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Yeah, that sounds like a blast. I’m having fun. Cramming as much life into my life as I can.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You’re doing drugs. Staying up all night, having sex with strangers.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: It sounds fun to me. Good night.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Close the incisions.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: She won't even have a scar.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Her 02 stats are dropping.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Did you nick something?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Procedure was clean. BP's strong.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Well, she's not breathing. We need to intubate.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: The breathing problem started after we fixed her kidney problem. Means the RTA isn't the underlying cause.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Where’s Thirteen?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Traffic’s bad. She’s probably just —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not here.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It’s not her lungs. No masses, no infiltrates.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Her lungs are working, but she still can't breathe.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Distribution plant can't distribute if it's not getting deliveries. If her lungs are fine, maybe the problem's in the supply line. Airway collapse.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: That could signal autoimmune or some kind of dystrophy as the underlying cause.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: There’s only one way to find out if her airway failed. Make it happen again. Stick Thirteen's carpet cleaner on a treadmill. Methacholine challenge. And someone find the carpet.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Exam going on. 15 minutes.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Good morning, Dr. Hadley.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Just spoke to my brother.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And by brother, you mean?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I mean my parents' other son.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Wow. Same dad.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Got a call last week from your PI. You lied. You did have me investigated. You’ve been taunting the team with what you've learned, but you never came after me. Means you couldn't find anything.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You’re right.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That’s because you haven't done anything stupid, spontaneous, or even vaguely interesting since you were 17. And that's just sad.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I found her in the clinic giving herself IV fluids.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: At least you could've let her finish. She looks terrible.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: She has a fresh nightclub stamp on her wrist. She’s in no condition to practice.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Unless this is a prelude to an actual spanking, there's no reason for me to be —

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I want her to take a drug test.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You can't make me do that.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: But I can suspend you until you do.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Because she went to a nightclub in her free time? Or because she had sex in her free time? Patient was undergoing routine surgery for RTA. Didn’t need Thirteen here for that. And I don't need you making my employees punch a clock or pee in a cup. Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Come on.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: By the way, the surgery was not routine, patient stopped breathing and you missed a differential. You’re fired.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: What? You just defended me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, I just prevented you from getting a drug test. Probably saved your career. I’m already taking responsibility for one doctor with a drug habit.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I don't have a drug habit.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The slutty party girl is fun till she pukes on your shoes. Then she's just a pain in the ass.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I haven't sat on this couch for four months. It remembers my cheeks. I miss this.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Me too. Me trying to work. You interrupting.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, come on. Your patients can wait five minutes. Get me caught up. Come on, what did you do? Travel? Did you get a new hobby? Did you meet someone?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Actually, yes. I sort of, started, dating someone.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Great. What does she do? Is she… an actress?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: No. Why would you think that?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I just figured you'd want something a little more… Exciting…

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: She’s not… You’re gonna find out anyway because you're gonna meet her. She’s… a prostitute. Used to be. She made some mistakes. Single mom, had some drug issues. But… she's so smart. She wants to go to law school. And… I told her I’d help her with tuition.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: How long have you known her?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I knew you'd be like this.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I asked a question.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: House… You are a drug addict. You go to prostitutes. You can't be judgmental.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And yet.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Please, don't do this to me. I was hurting, and I wanted to feel good. I didn't expect it… to go this way. I… Amber… Said that she wanted me to move on. That she wanted me to… Be happy. And — Debbie, makes me happy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If you're happy, I’m…

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I heard.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Yeah. I’m looking for my ticket back.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Sorry if I upset you. I didn't want to invade your privacy.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: It wasn't your fault. Can you get me caught up?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Think you're gonna find something we didn't?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: It’s good for the patient. Good for me.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Films are clean. We ruled out hypertension. Guys have her on a treadmill running a methacholine challenge. And I still think you've been acting like an idiot.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I know. Did you talk about whether this lung field looks a little dark?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It’s probably just over-exposed.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Or her diaphragm's a little flat. Could be a sign of hyperinflation.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Suggests a pulmonary obstruction.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Lung cysts. They wouldn't show up on an X-ray. Treadmill test isn't gonna close her airway. It’ll make her lungs explode.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Her throat's fine. We made her airway collapse, but it's not collapsed.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You ruptured a cyst! Her lung collapsed.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Breath sounds on both sides.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Move. Trachea’s deviating to the left.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Nice.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Chest CT confirmed multiple lung cysts, one of which burst during the treadmill test.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Luckily, Thirteen figured out the problem and was there to re-inflate her lung.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Lung cysts plus all her other symptoms could be amyloidosis, which we can manage. Or pulmonary fibrosis which —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Thank you. My employees can take care of it from here. We need to biopsy the cysts.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You fired me because I screwed up. I just proved I can pull my weight.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: All you proved is you know how to make an entrance.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: House, she deserves another shot. She found the cysts, saved the patient.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Who wouldn't have needed saving if Thirteen had shown up at the differential in the first place.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Give her her job back, House.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Or what? You’re gonna quit? Go do the biopsy.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: How much clearer do I need to make this?

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: What does that even mean, "dating a hooker"?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He’s an idiot with a messiah complex. Savior to all who need saving. That’s why his first wife had a wooden leg. Second wife was Canadian. He’s the one who needs to be saved.

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: From you or the ho?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The ho's just using him for his money. Wait. Bad example.

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: Normally in these situations, I’d follow the girl, find out something embarrassing about her to show him. But since that's our starting position…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Proceed directly to the leg-breaking.

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: I’m not breaking her legs. She probably has a pimp. Or, at least, an older brother. Or a younger brother. Or overprotective sister.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Find her, find her family, find client number nine. Just get me something I can use to force her to back off.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Sorry to interrupt your meeting, Mannix. Here’s the result from the lung biopsy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Why not men? You’re bisexual. If you were just being self-destructive, you'd be having random sex with men. Better chance of getting assaulted, catching a disease. If this were just about getting laid, it'd be a lot easier to pick up men. Or ugly girls. This woman's hot. Which means you like the challenge, the conquest. It’s the control that gets you off. And controlling women is as close as you can get to controlling what's gonna happen to you.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Here I thought I was just into boobs.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Instead of getting sweaty with a stranger, why don't you try taking it to the next level? Play God. Tell a girl that she's got ten years to live. She has LAM.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: This is not a test. You’re not getting your job back if you can —

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I know what it's like to get this news, and no one should have to get it from you.

utterance.speaker: Spencer
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: The biopsy of your lung cyst showed smooth muscle cells. That’s indicative of a disease called LAM.

utterance.speaker: Spencer
utterance.content: What do you do for that?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Surgery to remove the cysts. But… They’ll come back. Little by little, the cysts replace healthy lung tissue until your lungs stop working.

utterance.speaker: Spencer
utterance.content: I’m gonna die.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Yes. I’m so sorry.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: They removed all the cysts they could. That should help you breathe better.

utterance.speaker: Spencer
utterance.content: How long until the cysts come back?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: We don't know exactly. I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Spencer
utterance.content: Stop saying you're sorry.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I know you're scared.

utterance.speaker: Spencer
utterance.content: I don't know what I feel.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You’re gonna be numb for a few more days. Then you'll go home and cry for a few weeks. And then you get angry. Start telling yourself nothing matters anymore. You start doing stupid things. Maybe you go out to bars and pick up a bunch of women.

utterance.speaker: Spencer
utterance.content: You’re… How long do you have?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Maybe a little more than you. Maybe a little less. I’ll race you.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I was thinking maybe I’d come back later.

utterance.speaker: Spencer
utterance.content: Sounds good.

utterance.speaker: Spencer
utterance.content: Oh, God. What’s going on?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: All her blood counts are down. It’s a new symptom. Aplastic anemia.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Does the word "fired" have some whole other definition that I’m not aware of?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I don't work for you. Fine. Don’t pay me. Just let me finish out this case.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So you like her now that she's dying. What happens if she stops dying?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: There’s no danger of that right now. If we don't figure out what's wrong with her, she's got days, not years.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Aplastic anemia takes LAM off the table. Unfortunately, none of our other choices are any better. PNH with some sort of respiratory infection.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Best case gives her 12 years.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Or fast-moving Langerhans.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: A few months.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Or mastocytosis, which can cause systemic shock and kill her in days.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Go. Test for everything. Not you. You’re just a visitor.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: How’s your patient?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: She doesn't have Langerhans.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: That’s good.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Actually, a cancer diagnosis would be good news right now. Do you think… I’m boring?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You’re saying that just to screw with me.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Yeah. Why would you expect anything else?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I expect House to pull my strings. I expect Cameron to make me feel better. I expect the new team to kiss my ass. And I expect you to be honest, 'cause you don't give a crap.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Yes, you're boring. That speech was boring.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Thanks so much.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You don't let other people's problems affect you. You don't let your own problems affect you. And it's the screw-ups that make us interesting. You’re never out of control. Which is good, and… boring. Never losing control also means you're never putting yourself out there. Never pushing your limits. On the other hand, you do have a tattoo, so… Maybe I’m wrong.

utterance.speaker: Spencer
utterance.content: I’m glad you're here.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She needs a bone marrow transplant.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Test results are back? What’s she positive for?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nothing. But we've got a donor match.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Jumping to a transplant when we don't know what she —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I know she has a blood disorder. Could be PNH. She needs a bone marrow transplant. Or leukemia. She needs a bone marrow transplant. Or thalassemia. She needs a bone marrow —

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Yeah, I get it. But she'll never survive total body irradiation.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So we don't radiate her. Her marrow's nearly wiped out already. Counts almost zero.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: "Almost" being the key word. The new marrow would attack the old marrow. She’ll die from graft-versus-host.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You got a better idea? She trusts you. Go get her consent.

utterance.speaker: Lucas
utterance.content: Sometimes I find out things you'd rather not know. This was in his trash. He’s using.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You’re back.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Genius.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Damn. I knew the fake works was too much.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, you had no choice. Where were you gonna go after fake hooker girlfriend? How did you know he was outside?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Cane prints. I’m actually kind of insulted. No way I’m a drug addict, but you completely buy that I fell in love with a prostitute?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You played to your strengths. By which I mean you played to your weaknesses. Oh, my God. You invoked your dead girlfriend's name to sell me. You’re my hero.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Best $30 I ever spent.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It’s $30? Did you keep her number?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Unfortunately, I killed her and buried her in the basement.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Shame. Hungry?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So, seriously. Where were you the other morning?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Ugh, don't make me do this again. It has nothing to do with you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Then tell me.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: We’re going bowling on Monday. I’m coming over to play poker this weekend. Nothing’s changed. You have to trust that.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You’re gonna keep following me, aren't you?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It’s what we do.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Be outside my apartment at 8:00 tonight.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: She said yes to the transplant.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Good. You’re in a downward spiral of destruction.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I can stop.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You’re gonna keep spiraling. Keep screwing around. Slashing away at every person who tries to help until no one tries to help anymore. Till you hit bottom. Till you're dead. Until then… I can use you.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You’re hiring me back?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You did good work.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I did good work yesterday, and I was still fired. What changed? You wanted me to spend time with her. See if I could still make a connection.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You connected with a diagnosis, not with her.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You’re trying to save me, trying to control me. You’re doing exactly what you think that I’m —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Cracks. You’re lips are cracked. You been using your inhaler lately?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Allergies. Don’t deflect. You always deflect.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Did she cry? When you told her that she was gonna die, did she cry?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: She… got upset. She —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Were. there. tears?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Chopping an onion releases a mist of syn-propanethial-s-oxide, a chemical irritant which causes people to have a very predictable reaction.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: She has no tears.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It was either this or put on Brian’s song. I didn't have time to stop by Wilson’s. She has Sjogren's. It attacks the glands that produce tears and saliva. Also, by the way, causes lung cysts and RTA.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: It doesn't cause bleeding.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It’s like you and men. Just 'cause you usually don't, doesn't mean you can't.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: And it doesn't cause cracked lips in other people.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Lack of spit makes her mouth a breeding ground for a fungus like Candida. Your asthma inhaler did the same for you. Wiped out your mouth's immune system.

utterance.speaker: Spencer
utterance.content: So she's got what I’ve got.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Just the opportunistic infection, not the underlying condition. Another life saved by girl-on-girl action.

utterance.speaker: Spencer
utterance.content: I’m gonna be okay?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You’re gonna be okay.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Methylprednisolone to get the Sjogren’s under control. And some artificial tears to maximize the visual impact of this moment.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Spencer’s gonna be fine. And I hear you got your job back. I’m gonna keep standing here until you say something.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I feel alone. And, she hasn't gone anywhere.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: She gets to live.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I’m gonna go home. I’m tired.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: What do you think?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, my God! You guys shop here too? Best nipples in Princeton.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Why are you here?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Because he ate the donut.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I’m so sorry. He must've followed me.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I’m sure.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, you're clearly not pregnant, so either you're buying this as a gift, or this is some kind of weird "if you build it, they will come" moment.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I’m adopting a baby.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: She asked me to be a character reference. That’s where I was the other morning. I’m sorry. I couldn't betray her confidence.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I didn't want anyone else to know in case I didn't get approved. Today, I did.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Are you gonna congratulate me?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If you're happy, I’m —
